channel.title: Python on Shreyas Ragavan
channel.description: Recent content in Python on Shreyas Ragavan

item.title: Jupyter notebooks to Org source + Tower of Babel
item.description: This post provides a simple example demonstrating how a shell script can be called with appropriate variables from any Org file in Emacs. The script essentially converts a Jupyter notebook to Org source, and Babel is leveraged to call the script with appropriate variables from any Org file. This reddit thread and blog post elucidate the advantages of using Babel and Org mode over Jupyter notebooks. Directly editing code in a Jupyter notebook in a browser is not an attractive long term option and is inconvenient even in the short term.

description: Scheduler Psuedo-Algorithm Introduction Code On Github Presentation Wiki on Github This is a Python script for a portable, scalable job scheduler with multiple priorities - for ANSYS CFX simulations. The script was designed to be called every minute by an external scheduler program. In the practical case, the free version of the software System Scheduler was used to deploy the script successfully, for over 3 years, managing 2 computing clusters.

item.title: On-line Courses: Code School
item.description: Completed several courses covering python, git, SQL,regular expressions. Most of these courses were completed during the occasional Free Weekend opportunities from Code School, where the paid courses are available to be completed at no cost, for an entire weekend.” My Code School Report is no longer available, since Pluralsight seem to be revamping these courses. However, these were great introductory courses.
